content: Former constituency of Singapore **Rural East Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore) represented in the [Legislative Council of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore) from 1948 until 1951. It elected one Legislative Council member. The constituency was formed in 1948 and cover the areas of [Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio), [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok), [Changi](/wiki/Changi), [Pulau Tekong](/wiki/Pulau_Tekong), [Pulau Ubin](/wiki/Pulau_Ubin), [Paya Lebar](/wiki/Paya_Lebar), [Punggol](/wiki/Punggol), [Serangoon](/wiki/Serangoon), [South Seletar](/wiki/Seletar), [Tampines](/wiki/Tampines), [Teban](/wiki/Teban_Gardens) and [Ulu Bedok](/wiki/Bedok). In 1951, the constituency was abolished and split into [Changi](/wiki/Changi_Constituency) and [Seletar constituencies](/wiki/Seletar_Constituency). ## Legislative Council member ElectionMemberParty(/wiki/1948_Singaporean_general_election)[Sardon Jubir](/wiki/Sardon_Jubir)[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1940s [General Election 1948](/wiki/1948_Singaporean_general_election): Rural East PartyCandidateVotes%Â±%**[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)****[Sardon Jubir](/wiki/Sardon_Jubir)** **607** **54.9** [Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)Cheong Hock Chye49845.1[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)1099.8[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)1,14454.7[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)2,092[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician) **win** This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Rural East Constituency
